website_summaries.verdict: A versatile, durable, and full-featured cooler for every occasion.
pros: Tough, armored construction with 3 inches of PermaFrost insulation
Holds 28 cans with a recommended 2:1 ice ratio, but can hold many more without ice
Includes heavy-duty rubber latches, an interlocking lid, military-grade polyester rope handles, anchorpoint tie-downs, and non-slip feet
cons: Some users reported water leaking out of the drain nozzle

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 30 minutes on maiden voyage
customer_reviews.text: I just returned from a deployment and got to set my Yeti 45 on her maiden voyage at the NASCAR race at PIR. I spent a good amount of time fancying her up with patches and stickers from the recent deployment. It took about a half an hour before the latch broke. Piece of crap with $300 wasted and about an hour worth of time making her pretty. Never buying a Yeti again.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Mainer

customer_reviews.title: Not a cooler to rely on during a power outage
customer_reviews.text: This cooler, has thick walls which gave me hope that it would help keep things cold for days during the latest power outage. NOPE. It is not much better in retaining cold then my blue wheeled Colman Cooler. Ice did not remain for more than 2 days and the frozen bottled water defrosted in 3. No we did not open the cooler more than 2x a day. I would not recommend this cooler.
customer_reviews.author: EllyB

customer_reviews.title: Yeti-pricey but get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Yeah--like many others --I thought that the Yeti was overpriced---and maybe it is--but I got it for road trips--some into bear country--I looked at other coolers that were still pricey but not as much as the Yeti. I also wanted a cooler that would last -- well forever (barring disaster)--so maybe I paid a bit more--but I have more confidence in the Yeti holding up and keeping things cool! I've only used it once since purchasing (purchased a couple of weeks before this post)--had 18 cans in cooler with ice--ice hardly melted overnight! No regrets on the purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: RStoecky

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable ice retention
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband- needless to say he was very happy! We vacationed at Smith Mountain Lake in VA and took this cooler on the back of the boat. After three days of sun- we still had ice! I was skeptical about buying a YETI cooler because they are expensive. I don't know how this cooler is different than any other cooler except if we'd have put ice in our Coleman- it would have been gone at the end of the day. Three days in and we'd have had very warm drinks. I am very pleased with our YETI. We have coffee mugs and thermal drink coolers- love all of them!
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Every other cooler that I have bought over the years never kept frozen items frozen for any length of time. I bought this cooler for my daughter who lives five and a half hours away from home and after she packed the cooler and added the ice it was in the same shape when she arrived at her destination. No ice was melted and everything inside was kept frozen or cold. Love Yeti! I may have to get one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment!
customer_reviews.text: I use 1/2 the ice of my friend's Coleman and it lasts 2x as long. Theses are worth every $ you spend
customer_reviews.author: Tom L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit in the Boat!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a family member as a gift for always letting us go on their boat during the summer at lake havasu. We got a seadek top pad for it to match the boat and it doubles as a seat/table. At lake Havasu the temps got as high as 117° and we still had more than half the ice left by the end of the day. If we had known it would work this good we would have got them one a few years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Chris B. Garza

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Trying to return this item! Ice melted after 1 day I never ordered a replacement on this! Returned BOTH!!!!!! Credit my account! I NEVER ORDERED A REPLACEMENT
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seller not being honest about the condition of Yeti cooler!!!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not new in a box! Did not come in the original Yeti box. Seller was not being honest about the condition of the cooler! Should be advertised as open box with some damage! Buyer beware! Ask for an actual picture of the item!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Siwek

customer_reviews.title: Reef blue is lighter than pictured, but still very nice color!
customer_reviews.text: Weve used Yeti before but decided to finally get a 45. We got the reef blue & a lot of reviews mentioned the color on the site isnt accurate.. some even said it was a baby blue. Well, they aren't wrong in saying the color on the site is inaccurate, but I definitely wouldn't classify it as a baby blue. It is a little lighter, but still a pretty color of blue. This picture is more of the actual color in person.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela

customer_reviews.title: Yeti Tundra 45
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed the yeti does not keep the ice as I thought it would Water is cold but ice melts as fast as in my old Coleman cooler
customer_reviews.author: michael and Bonnie wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Yeti 45 cooler
customer_reviews.text: We needed a cooler for Tailgating that would keep our food constantly cold and not leak! Yeti was the answer . The Desert tan color is really really nice. But more importantly is the quality and design.I tried it our by putting ice packs in and see how long they stayed cold. -2 days later they had just started to thaw! Looking forward to adding another piece. Definitely recommend this product to anyone in need of a great cooler. Bear in mind Yeti's are not cheap- but they are worth their value.
customer_reviews.author: Marsi

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: It seems to keep ice longer. It doesn't hold much. I bought this for car trips. Anything bigger and it would have been difficult to carry around when necessary. It will only hold a days worth of food for 3 people (with the ice), but another cooler will be needed if you want to have enough food for a weekend trip. I can't tell you if its truly bear proof, but all it takes to open is pulling on the black tabs. I'm glad I did not spend my money on this - it was purchased with a gift card.
customer_reviews.author: MeiLani

customer_reviews.title: Ice thawed over 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: When my Yeti arrived, we cooled it down and did some test of how well it would hold ice. We covered the bottom with a layer of ice and it melted within 24 hours. This test was done in my house with a temp of 65 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: would have liked to have wheels
customer_reviews.text: I did not need this cooler for anything in particular, i just purchased it when it was part of the Prime day deals. It came in handy when i was emptying out my refrigerator. However, it is cumbersome, heavy and does not have wheels. The igloo cooler we have had for over 15 years is light weight, has wheels and a handle to pull. This Yeti cooler doesn't lend itself to transporting it around to any locations. Unless you have someone strong who doesnt mind lugging it everywhere. And that is even without filling it. Also, the walls are quite thick, which likely helps with insulation, but that also reduces the storage capacity of the cooler and makes it heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Leila Samhan

customer_reviews.title: Best cooler. period.
customer_reviews.text: The best cooler I have ever owned. I live in Las Vegas which can get extremely hot. I did not pre-ice as instructed and this kept COLD! It sat in the sun the whole day, ice barley melted and drinks amd food cold. Next day I had moved it inside my hot truck where it sat for the majority of the day... ice still barley melted!!! This cooler is an absolute beast and I will be purchasing the 65 Tundra to add!!! I can't reccomend this cooler or brand enough.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Not living up to expectation
customer_reviews.text: Got this Yeti in September and started using it recently. It doesn't keep ice longer than a few hours which I find very annoying. I bought based on a recommendation and after reading all the reviews. I have a friend who assures me that is Yeti holds ice for 3 days. He's been using mine to test it and he agrees mine doesn't live up to Yeti quality. i am not sure what has happened here, but this cooler is way to expensive to be performing far worse than an igloo.
customer_reviews.author: nissy

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I tried several other ice chests at lower costs than YETI. Like many others, it's hard to spend that much money on an ice chest. So I tried others. None performed at the level this one did. Ice kept for almost a week of frequent opening and closing. Yes the weather was cooler, in the high 60's low 70's, but again, frequent opening the ice chest (we camp with several little ones, and they constantly open and close it!), still kept ice longer than other similar ice chests. Overall, my opinion is that you get what you pay for. I'm happy with the product and would buy again if I had the need for another ice chest.
customer_reviews.author: TX VR6

customer_reviews.title: Legendary name brand, but may not be best value for money
customer_reviews.text: My milk spoiled on the 3rd day. Frozen water bottles lasted 2 days. Really bad smell after first use was difficult remove. Some staining noted on the top lid after first use that doesn't clean off. Seams otherwise rock solid but may not be worthy of the $300 dollars I spent on it. Time will tell, however.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Scalia

customer_reviews.title: Hardest thing is choosing what color you want!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding. I spent an eternity (felt like it anyway) looking at coolers. In person and online. I have 5 or 6 various sized coolers from over the years. All of these have some type of leak or hinge failures. This cooler is the last I intend on buying. Well, I did buy a smaller YETI cooler for store runs and small trips. Don't waste your money on several coolers over the years. Yes, they are expensive however you get what you pay for in most cases. Very pleased with this purchase. B-]
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian buyer

customer_reviews.title: Fits into my compact vehicles.
customer_reviews.text: Qualit/performance (rotomolded) dimension & capacity mattered most to me while shopping for a cooler, this time around. All considered, I went with a YETI 45 b/c it fits perfectly into my compact vehicles & the capacity is sufficient for two to three days. The performance is satisfactory as well. Keeps my food refrigerated during my 13 hour shift. I wasn’t keen on the sand color, so I went with white. White supposedly reflects heat better than any other colour. So, there’s that. Only notable negatives are the weight & the $299.00 price tag. However, I ordered Badger wheels & I typically keep coolers for ten years or more before replacing them.
customer_reviews.author: 4renzixs

customer_reviews.title: probably not ' bear proof' as the tag claims
customer_reviews.text: very heavy . difficult to carry empty. held shut with rubber tabs. claims to be bear proof.. ( Im from Maine so I know a thing or two on this subject) I guess it would take a good bear beating with 2 padlocks in the provided holes..
customer_reviews.author: rhondajones

customer_reviews.title: The greatest man cave frig!
customer_reviews.text: The best!! My husband loves it. Do YOURSELF A FAVOR.... make sure Amazon packs it well for the delivery like for a gift. If not, it might get stolen off your porch. Factory box labeled too well!
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Not what i expected.
customer_reviews.text: most of the yeti looked used and not up to par. it had scratches all over it and i was not impressed. it also came in with a tag on it for $100 cheaper. i understand the yeti will get tore up eventuality but buying it brand new i expect better. but they were very prompt in responding to me and filing my return and getting my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Adalyn Burge

customer_reviews.title: Super Pricey but does work.
customer_reviews.text: Got his for my father on Fathers Day and he loves it, keeps his beers and food cool when we travel or he goes to parties. Ice lasts for like DAYS in this thing and even when it melts the water is still super cold.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Witt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: The best ice chest I've ever owned. The size of the 45 is perfect for a sedan, SUV, or trucks. It's also easier to carry than the larger chests, and has enough room for a group of 4-6 people on a vacation or other extended outing.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say....it's a YETI! Read directions first! I wasnt aware that you are to "condition" the cooler before each use. Just add ice 15 minutes before use. It lasts for days. Get the cooler cold before putting food/drinks in it, like a refrigerator. Only had to buy ice on initial use and after 4 days upon returning home. Awesome cooler!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy L. Richards

customer_reviews.title: yeti as usual!
customer_reviews.text: Good product. A refrigerator stopped working and we needed to put the necessary items, baby's milk, in something to keep until the new refrigerator was installed and cooled down. This cooler , as all yeti products. was a great help.
customer_reviews.author: DWright

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed Yeti
customer_reviews.text: Buy a Tundra 45 reef blue, today it was the first time I used it and it has a Water leak on the drain plug and ice melted quickly. I purchased this yeti cooler on Amazon and it was shipped to me to Honduras. Once I got it I registered on my online user. Need a solution ASAP I always trust yeti until now very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar García Osorio

customer_reviews.title: Works !!
customer_reviews.text: The inside of this cooler is not as big as I expected but it definitely works well. We picked it full of food for a 4 day camping trip. The original ice we packed in it was still frozen at the end of our trip. We also brought a cheaper Coleman cooler for other items and all the ice had melted and needed to be replaced on day 2.
customer_reviews.author: KeNa

customer_reviews.title: This Is The Only Cooler You Will Ever Need
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted one for over a year. Not only is this the most expensive cooler on the market it is also The sturdiest and holds ice longer than I expected in the hot sun. If you have the money buy Yeti. It is the last cooler you will ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat it but still too pricey.
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler. Hard to beat it. Took it on vacaction for 8 days and I put ice in it once. Keeps things colder than anything else. Just over priced. I didn’t pay full price out of pocket or I never would bought one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim & Mary

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: After years of buying cheap coolers I can finally see why spending a little extra for something that will last a lifetime is worth it. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: MT Jeep

customer_reviews.title: it's a yeti !!!  You can never go wrong with a yeti
customer_reviews.text: This was a great cooler. We ended up returning at and getting the 65. This was only because of the value of the 65 at the time. Nothing was wrong with the 45 we just thought for a little bit more money we could get the 65. But all in all it's a yeti and you can't go wrong with the yeti
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Pricey and ice melts to fast
customer_reviews.text: You would think for $400 the ice would last longer, I'm constantly pouring out to the water to keep some perishables from getting soaked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it for ice/drinks in the RV
customer_reviews.text: Great for drinks/ice in an RV. Got tired of buying ice in remote places while RVing. I have a larger Yeti so I know they work well. This new one doesn’t disappoint. Keeps ice 3 times longer than my old cooler. It’s heavy. Still holds a 30 pack. I froze small blocks of ice (3"x3"x6") that worked great. They lasted for 4-5 days in the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gaddis

customer_reviews.title: You will love it!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this. Im on vacation in Utah, cooler is in the back seat of my RAM. Every OTHER day, I throw a bag of ice in to keep for my riding pack and a few cold drinks. Yes, Moab, 100 degrees, locked car and the ice lasts 2 days pretty much. Amazing. Worth every single penny.
customer_reviews.author: jackhammerliveaudio

customer_reviews.title: Underachieving so far.
customer_reviews.text: I really wasn’t impressed with my first Yeti cooler experience. I have several of the tumblers and they are dependable and sturdy. I was expecting the same performance from the tundra cooler. It’s maiden voyage was a work golf function. The cooler wouldn’t hold ice for more than agree hours before is was water. It wasn’t even that hot or humid. I will continue to use it, I’m just left a little disappointed at this moment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Barker

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep ice from melting within the 7-10 days.
customer_reviews.text: After contiplating on spending the money on a Yeti for quite some time I am disappointed in having the ice melt within 2-3 days. I followed the directions given with the cooler on how to properly fill the cooler. 7-10 days is what is says in the booklet if done properly. Not a chance. My cheap igloo is no different than the Yeti.
customer_reviews.author: Scott McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is even better than expected! Yes $300 is a lot to spend on a cooler but we bought it for our boat and it did not disappoint. We put a 20lb bag of ice in it on a Thursday afternoon and there was still a large chunk of ice in it on Sunday night!!! It sat outside in the full sun the entire time in 80 degrees temps. I was skeptical to buy a yeti but I am so glad I did. The only thing I do not love about it is the weight once packed, it is too heavy for me to lug around so my husband has to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Sieklucki

customer_reviews.title: It's a Yeti, so you know it's good.
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason this company has the great reputation it does. You can't go wrong with this cooler! Just be aware that they are a little smaller on the inside than you expect, but that's why they stay so cold. Look at the internal dimensions before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best cooler
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the best cooler I have bought to date. It's keeps your drinks ice cold not just cold.
customer_reviews.author: James P Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my SUV camper conversion
customer_reviews.text: I'm having my BMW X1 SUV converted into a mini-camper for extended road trips, as in Portland OR to Gainesville, FL. The Yeti 45 is compact enough to fit my vehicle without cramping space and (BONUS) it works with the divider and two dry-goods baskets. I seriously considered a Dometic but this serves my needs nicely. Many road trips are ahead so I added the bear proof lock and security cable so neither fierce animals nor unscrupulous thief's can make off with it.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi

customer_reviews.title: Its YETI...
customer_reviews.text: I mean its YETI...I love it...should I payed for it...no. Did I want to and fully satisfied...100%
customer_reviews.author: Bryan H.

customer_reviews.title: Over priced
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the weight, too heavy to move around and space too small for size of container. Not much room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yeti is worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This Yeti 45 is great for travel. It’s the right size for two people. And I can lift it. Bought the desert tan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s just a cooler
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a fan of Yeti products but never had their cooler. I scored a deal on warehouse deals so it made the deal more sweet. Definitely would not pay retail for one of these coolers. But works nice and plenty of room for our camping needs.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Ice to stay frozen
customer_reviews.text: The ice was melted within 2 hrs of packing my cooler for the day out on the water! I was completely shocked when I opened the cooler the first time to get beverages out for everyone and was greeted by cold water instead of ice.
customer_reviews.author: amy B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping. Chose this size because of the way it fits in my vehicle and because it’s the biggest one I can pick up alone when full. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Radarchick

customer_reviews.title: Yeti makes the BEST coolers!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this cooler! It is a replacement for our Igloo Marine cooler! It is so tough! We even bought the seat for the top of the cooler!
customer_reviews.author: Daytona675

customer_reviews.title: It was a heavy duty cooler
customer_reviews.text: We bought the cooler for a gift and even though they haven’t used it yet they were thrilled to get it as they go the lake a lot during the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Mary P

customer_reviews.title: Stays cold
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted a yeti! But a bit disappointed ice melts so quickly it stays cold but no ice
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy even when empty.
customer_reviews.text: This weighed 28 pounds when empty. Could not have moved it if filled. Reordered one with wheels. Just too heavy!
customer_reviews.author: Pjbaustralia

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! We were so excited to receive it and have gotten much use out of it already!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Tallant

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment!
customer_reviews.text: This yeti was the perfect size for our family beach and camping trips. We were looking to upgrade into something better than the standard igloo and this met the mark. Worth the investment; plan to keep for a lifetime. Even in the Florida heat, ice keeps for days!
customer_reviews.author: Rannae Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Is the Coolers
customer_reviews.text: They are still in the boxes. They are going to be birthday resents for my two children in November. I am sure they will love them.
customer_reviews.author: Mattie to 3 grandsons

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased as a gift to my husband. He loves it and it keeps thing so cold for much longer than the average cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Schwarz

customer_reviews.title: Yes to Yeti
customer_reviews.text: Love our new cooler! It is everything we thought it would be. Keeps everything nice and cold. Wonderful for a road trip!
customer_reviews.author: Valorie J. Marschall

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little small inside. I can drink six beers in an hour so who needs a cooler that won’t hold more than 12 cans??
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Kind of expensive but worth the price. Keeps beer and sodas cold for a long time. Looks great too. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: rande

customer_reviews.title: Yeti does it again
customer_reviews.text: Yeti products are just better. Some people have bad experiences. It happens. But it this one. This thing is a tank. Plenty of room and keeps stuff cold for an absurdly long time. Coolers have one job... keep stuff cold. This one does that and looks good doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Well made, wish i got bigger one. Unsurpassed ability to keep stuff cold. 14 hours in hot Arkansas...still had ice end of day.
customer_reviews.author: David D Fish

customer_reviews.title: Replaced our soft yeti with this, and so happy!
customer_reviews.text: We loved the soft tote Yeti but needed something that lasted longer so we traded it in for this cooler and were so pleased! Things stayed cool much longer and it's not too bad to travel with, this size works great. We also traveled with it attached to the roof of our car on a roadtrip and it held up so well! Seems to very durable. We look forward to all the future uses we'll get out of it!
customer_reviews.author: Zoë Mattioli

customer_reviews.title: Love my Yeti
customer_reviews.text: My Yeti was delivered ahead of scheduled. I haven't field tested it yet but put 2 1-gallon ice jugs in it in my house. 6 days later, ice was mostly melted but temp was still 40 F. Very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann Conness

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Kept everything cold and the ice cold for days. Had to drain it just once and re-add ice once during our 5 day trip.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Baker

customer_reviews.title: It is okay but not impressed
customer_reviews.text: This one is smaller than the 65 but still just as heavy for the size. To high priced for something that isn't easy to move around. I wrote a review on the 65 so read that review to get my real thoughts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a softball fundraiser. Love the color and wish I would have bought myself one
customer_reviews.author: cassie m.

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend love this I accidentally broke his old cooler when it fell off the back of the pick up when I surprised him with us at Christmas he was so excited very durable nice spacious best gift
customer_reviews.author: Lexi Kaine Music

customer_reviews.title: Yeti quality
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful - just as I hoped! Beware. The outer packaging reveals what’s inside!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Great ice chest
customer_reviews.text: Liked everything. It is sturdy, easy to carry, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: pbelardi

customer_reviews.title: Best cooler around
customer_reviews.text: I needed to transport my medicines in a cold environment for a 7 day road trip, the yeti should do this with one ice replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: It keeps stuff cold.
customer_reviews.text: Durable. Sturdy. Used it in our trailer for 10 days while we day hiked Yosemite. I was skeptical at first; however, it does what it says it will do. Keeps stuff cold! I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: bassgruvn

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: I have a Coleman 40 qt and ordered the 45 qt yeti. Wouldnt you think it would be 5 qt larger? Nope inside is smaller than the Coleman. Are they measuring from tte outside because most people need to know how many quarts it holds inside! Returned.
customer_reviews.author: laurie

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn’t buy again! For the price it doesn’t keep as cold as advertised
customer_reviews.author: bill quaiver

customer_reviews.title: over priced
customer_reviews.text: while it may be good, it is over priced. As are most products from this company
customer_reviews.author: ric

customer_reviews.title: A bit disenchanted
customer_reviews.text: I was heading up into Nova Scotia and wanted to not worry about my food going bad because I didn’t feel like driving 15 miles for ice. Temps were between 50 and 65 and the ice only kept a few days without having the cooler opening and closing. I guess for $299.00 I was expecting a bit more than that😔
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.text: Used while camping in 90+ degree weather for 4 days. Only had to add about 4 pounds of ice the entire time. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: On the coast

customer_reviews.title: You can count on a Yeti
customer_reviews.text: Always a perfect choice with Yeti. Especially given that is “Certified Bear Resistant”! Good to know!
customer_reviews.author: m.smith

customer_reviews.title: Buy the best and forget the rest!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great unit! I love it because it is a quality product that looks like it will stand the test of time!
customer_reviews.author: Linda L Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Prep with ice before using and don't dump the cold water out.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Moorman

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Product came scratched all around the top like someone had dropped it on the ground a few times or it was previously owned before sending it to us. We need the cooler now so I can’t return it and wait for the new one but disappointed to pay $300 for something that came looking like it was already used.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Best cooler I've ever owned and likely the last I'll ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Ferencz

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it. Uses on Race weekends and is ...
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it. Uses on Race weekends and is kept in the outdoors for days on end. Holds ice for that whole time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler. Nice color. keep out of sun
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooler, ice did melt considerably overnight but we also used it for beers and it was sitting on our porch. So I think thats why. Great color, easy to open/close. Has rubber on bottom so it does not move around.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Only the best
customer_reviews.text: Unmatched quality. For the price, this cooler does what we expect it to.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: Very good cooler
customer_reviews.text: Very good cooler. Don’t even need to have ice directly on the things inside of it. It acts like a refrigerator when it’s kept sealed tight.
customer_reviews.author: Barcelo

customer_reviews.title: Reef blue is baby blue, color is totally off
customer_reviews.text: Color of reef blue is totally light baby blue, it’s really misleading.
customer_reviews.author: adam buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Jury still out
customer_reviews.text: We haven’t owned a Yeti before and are hoping it will keep our ice packs frozen for a long distance road trip. So the jury is still out. We’re hoping it lives up to the price.
customer_reviews.author: marcia nichols

customer_reviews.title: The best gift ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my son. He loves it. He has it in his man cave and he has the coldest beer around.
customer_reviews.author: e

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic cooler, it works great and i've had it keep ice for days straight, where our old cooler needed to be topped off, I would highly recommend the purchase, as long as you can grit your teeth through the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Reed

customer_reviews.title: GO CAMPING IN STYLE
customer_reviews.text: I love my cooler! The quality and color are both superb! I went camping with my Sasquatch researchers and did it in style and with the name YETI it was very fitting. Plus it kept the ice frozen for the entire trip! Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.author: S. Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Our Coleman cooler holds ice longer than this Yeti cooler
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Horr

customer_reviews.title: Durable cooler
customer_reviews.text: Kept food cold as needed and is durable. I’m glad I decided on this cooler
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: It’s quite heavy but keeps it cold
customer_reviews.text: I love the yeti very much. It keeps things cold all day the ice is still hard as a rock by evening time. The only bad thing is it’s very very heavy and we don’t have it totally failed but it’s quite heavy
customer_reviews.author: Cora Hudon

customer_reviews.title: The Cold Cooler
customer_reviews.text: It really keeps everything cold for a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Chozen

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful cooler
customer_reviews.text: Awesome color and product. It did not come with a drain plug
customer_reviews.author: Amy Foster

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase save your money!
customer_reviews.text: Can not believe I spent this amount of money on a cooler that does not hold ice. My 30 dollar Coleman cooler does a better job. Ice completely melts after a few hours and not being opened. Wish I didn’t spend my money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A waste of $300 Dollars
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is the heaviest and most cumbersome cooler that I have ever owned. The Yeti Tundra 35 is the worst $300.00 dollars I have ever spent in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Keeps beverages cold even in 100 degree weather. Very durable easy to drain
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy customer.
customer_reviews.text: Meets all expectations. Very solid cooler, which makes it heavy, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: zjl10

product_meta.title: YETI Tundra 45 Cooler
feature_bullets: The YETI Tundra 45 combines versatility with durability with a capacity of up to 26 cans with a recommended 2:1 ice-to-contents ratio
Ice stays ice thanks to up to 3 inches of PermaFrost Insulation and an extra thick FatWall design is certified Bear-Resistant

The Rotomolded Construction makes the Tundra armored to the core and virtually indestructible so wherever you decide to take it, this portable cooler’s sturdy construction will stand up to the rigors of the journey
All Tundra coolers feature T-Rex Lid Latches constructed of heavy-duty rubber so you’ll never see another busted latch and has patented keeper technology
The Tundra 45 dimensions are 25 1/2 in long x 16 in wide x 15 ½ in high with an empty weight of 23 lbs NOTE: All Tundra models come standard with one dry goods basket.
